title: Servicing | Preview document
summary: As a user, be able to preview the PDF for my documents so that I do not need to leave the page.
fullDescription:
Problem Statement:
As a user, I want to be able to preview the PDF for my documents so that I do not need to leave the page.

Acceptance Criteria:
  1. Upon clicking the icon to a view a document, a modal will open to preview the document with the following details:
    1. Document name will appear at the top of the modal.
    2. createdOn date will appear below the document name in mm/dd/yy format without leading zeros (different in mockup but consistent with Documents page).
    3. First document page preview will be displayed.
    4. User will be able to view current page and page count in the format # / # as depicted in the mockup.
    5. User will be able to view previous and following pages by clicking the up and down arrows as depicted in the mockup.
      1. Arrow will be disabled when user is on the first page.
      2. Down arrow will be disabled when the user is on the last page.
    6. Zoom percentage will be displayed to the right.
      1. Zoom will be 100% by default.
      2. Upon clicking �-�, zoom will be reduced, until disabled when at the lowest possible zoom.
      3. Upon clicking �+�, zoom will be increased, until disabled when at the highest possible zoom.
      4. Increments for zoom changes: 25%, 33%, 50%, 67%, 75%, 80%, 90%, 100%, 110%, 125%, 150%, 175%, 200%, 250%, 300%, 400%, 500%
    7. When zoom is more than 100%, user will be able to use a scrollbar to navigate to the contents not in view (not shown in mockup).
    8. User will be able to pinch to zoom and swipe to scroll on mobile and tablet.
    9. Download button will appear as depicted in the mockup.
      1. Upon clicking �Download�, the user will be prompted to save the file to the device.
    10. Upon clicking x in the top right of the modal as depicted in the mockup, the user will be redirected to the loan document list view.
    11. Upon clicking the Close button as depicted in the mockup, the user will be redirected to the loan document list view.
  2. If the document is unable to load, the error message "Not all data was able to be retrieved. Try refreshing your browser.  If the issue persists, come back later." will be displayed at the top of the card.

  3. The alt text for the icon will be changed to "Preview Document"

XD Mockup:

title: Servicing | Define Alert Display API Requirements for Home Portal [16 hours]
summary: Background The Borrower Portal already supports rendering alert banners for users and loan accounts.
fullDescription:
Background

The Borrower Portal already supports rendering alert banners for users and loan accounts. A new Admin capability is being introduced to allow business users to create and manage alert instances (including content, placement, targeting, lifecycle, and priority) without engineering involvement.

To support this, the Borrower Portal requires a well-defined API contract that provides all necessary alert data for display across supported pages (Login, Accounts, Loan level).

Objective

The goal of this spike is to define the API requirements and data contract needed by the Borrower Portal to retrieve and display alerts correctly, based on user context and loan context.

This spike will not implement the API, but will produce clear requirements and recommendations.

In Scope

  • Identify required API endpoints for alert retrieval

  • Define request parameters based on page context:

    • User-level (primary dashboard / login)

    • Loan-level (loan account page)

  • Define alert payload fields required for rendering:

    • Message content (unlimited length)

    • Severity (info / warning / urgent)

    • Dismissible flag

    • Placement locations

    • Priority / stacking order

    • CTA links

  • Define how compliance-controlled alerts are represented (read-only rules)

  • Define how multiple concurrent alerts are returned and ordered

  • Define how dismissed alerts are handled per user

  • Define timestamp and audit-related fields required for display logic

Out of Scope

  • Admin portal UI or workflows

  • Alert creation or editing logic

  • Business rule evaluation or compliance logic

  • Analytics or reporting

  • Notification center or non-banner alerts

Key Questions to Answer

  • Should the API be:

    • Single endpoint with context parameters, or

    • Multiple endpoints per page context?

  • How does the API determine:

    • Global vs loan-level alerts?

    • Active vs scheduled vs expired alerts?

  • How should dismissal state be persisted and queried?

  • How are loan-level alerts returned for multi-loan borrowers?

  • How are priority conflicts resolved in the API vs UI?

Deliverables

  • Proposed API endpoint(s) and usage patterns

  • Sample request/response payloads

  • Field-level definition for alert objects

  • Error and edge-case considerations

  • Recommendations for versioning and backward compatibility

title: Tech Debt | Investigate Instituting a "Pre-Deploy" Process
summary: Look into splitting our deployment process into two steps: - Deploying artifacts to deployment slot - Swapping slots Splitting these steps allows us to do a "pre-deploy" of artifacts so that any deployment issues can be addressed separately (e.g.
fullDescription:
Look into splitting our deployment process into two steps:

- Deploying artifacts to deployment slot
- Swapping slots

Splitting these steps allows us to do a "pre-deploy" of artifacts so that any deployment issues can be addressed separately (e.g. not during the deployment window) and create a smoother deployment.

title: Home Portal | Deprecate Site Introduction Modal for users after 8/8/2024 launch
summary: As a Home Portal user, I do not need to be made aware of launch upgrades after the site has been live for some time. Acceptance Criteria: Remove the Home Portal 8/8/2024 launch site introduction modal built via #24095 so that it no longer shows in any of the following scenarios on and after 9/18/2024: Upon any existing user clicking "Log In" on the Log In page ( https://dev.secure.cmghomeloans.com/login ) with accurate credentials who has not yet seen this modal (i.e., it is only shown to each user once after the release, and not again after that) Upon activating a new account via the Activate Account page, after the user has logged in with the new account Upon creating an account via the Create Account page Note: per 7/29/2024 conversation with @Cory Chandler this is just a database change on the announcement table to add an end-date to the modal, but this will be left in the code for if/, a message similar to this is reinstated in the future.
fullDescription:
Problem Statement: 
As a Home Portal user, I do not need to be made aware of launch upgrades after the site has been live for some time. 

Acceptance Criteria:
Remove the Home Portal 8/8/2024 launch site introduction modal built via #24095 so that it no longer shows in any of the following scenarios on and after 9/18/2024:
  1. Upon any existing user clicking "Log In" on the Log In page (https://dev.secure.cmghomeloans.com/login) with accurate credentials who has not yet seen this modal (i.e., it is only shown to each user once after the release, and not again after that)
  2. Upon activating a new account via the Activate Account page, after the user has logged in with the new account
  3. Upon creating an account via the Create Account page

Note:  per 7/29/2024 conversation with @Cory Chandler this is just a database change on the announcement table to add an end-date to the modal, but this will be left in the code for if/when a message similar to this is reinstated in the future

title: Home Portal | Partially hide loan number by default and add ability to view or hide full number
summary: As a user, I want my loan number to be partially hidden unless, view it so that my information is more secure.
fullDescription:
Problem Statement:
As a user, I want my loan number to be partially hidden unless I need to view it so that my information is more secure.

Acceptance Criteria:
  1. Loan Number will be partially hidden so that only the last 4 digits are displayed by default in the following locations:
    1. On the Loan Application and Mortgage Account cards which appear on the primary dashboard.
    2. On the Loan Application and Mortgage Account dashboards.

    3. On the Documents page.

  2. Eye icon will be displayed next to the loan number.

    1. Upon clicking the eye icon, the remaining numbers will be revealed and the eye icon will change to indicate hidden state.

title: Home Portal | Docutech - Get eSign Tasks Item
summary: ID Acceptance Criteria AC1 eSign Task Type displays only
fullDescription:
Problem Statement

Borrowers currently have no ability to view or electronically sign loan disclosures directly from the Home Portal. This results in extra navigation steps and inconsistent borrower experiences across document workflows.

Objective

Enable borrowers to view and electronically sign disclosure document packages directly from the Home Portals Task Page.

This feature will leverage new disclosure package APIs to retrieve document details and will display the eSign task only when the Feature Flag #67129 is enabled.

References

  • Design Figma: HP Task Card
    • Note that for any difference between the Figma and the mockups found in this requirement, the requirement version takes precedence.
  • Test Loans for Dev: Disclosures API Test Matrix.xlsx
  • Dashboard Access Ticket: #77063
  • Task Page Framework Ticket: #77067
  • eSign Action Page Ticket #79993
  • Remove Feature Flag #67129
  • API Development #79934, #84383 (Production release 11/10/25)

Scope

  • Implement a new eSign Task Type under the Home Portal Task Framework.

  • The corresponding eSign Action Page will be implemented under a separate work item (#79993).

  • Display eSign tasks only when eSignTask Feature Flag is enabled.

  • Use EPS endpoint /api/v1/loanfiles/getloansummarybulk to pull borrower information to identify logged in user (email address match)

  • Integrate with EX teams new /api/v1/disclosures/packages/details/loanfile/{fileDataId} endpoint to source data.

  • Show document package tasks for the logged-in borrowers loan only

  • Handle both Pending (unsigned) and Completed (signed or expired) states.

Dependencies

  • Feature Flag "NewTasks" must be active.

  • EX Team APIs:

    • #79934 Create eSign package details API endpoint.

Requirements

  1. This work item provides requirements for the eSign Task type displayed in the new Tasks page.
  2. Create new feature flag "eSignTask" - This task type (eSign) will only display when the eSignTask feature flag is enabled.

  3. Source Data for eSign Tasks will be based on the data returned from /api/v1/disclosures/packages/details/loanfile/{fileDataId}
    1. eSign Tasks displayed will initially only be those associated with the primary application since we do not currently support coborrower access to Home Portal.  However, coborrower access is coming soon and will need to be supported. 
    2. eSign tasks will not exist until a loan has been created for the application.
        1. *Depedency* New API endpoint being created by the EX team. #79934 & #84383.  Sample payload attached.
      1. Only packages with delivery method = "eSign" are eligible for task display.
      2. Filter document package display to include tasks only for those specifically for the user's loan based on Byte Borrower ID matched to Borrower Email Address
        1. To determine Byte Borrowers for which esign packages should be included:
          1. Call API endpoint api/v1/loanfiles/getloansummarybulk for borrower contact information based on FileDataID
            1. Response will include an object for each application, with each borrower/coborrower associated
          2. Match the userid (email address) of the current logged in user to the email address for each borrower in the response.
          3. When a match is found
            1. If a single match is found, use the Byte Borrower ID for the matching borrower
            2. If multiple matches are found, use the Byte Borrower ID for all borrowers
          4. Use the Byte Borrower ID(s) to match Borrowers per disclosure package
      3. A separate task will display for each package + borrower id
        1. To determine Byte Borrower IDs to include for current logged in user profile,
          1. Call API endpoint api/v1/loanfiles/getloansummarybulk for borrower contact information based on FileDataID
            1. Response will include an object for each application, with each borrower/coborrower associated
          2. Match the userid (email address) of the logged in user to the email address for each borrower in the response.
          3. When a match is found
            1. If a single match is found, use the Byte Borrower ID for the matching borrower
              1. If there is a coborrower on the same application, ALSO use the Coborrower's Byte Borrower ID regardless of matching email address.
            2. If multiple matches are found on the same application, use the Byte Borrower ID for all borrowers on the application.
            3. If multiple matches are found across applications, use the Byte Borrower ID for all matching borrowers
              1. Since we cannot determine the specific borrower id for the logged in user in this scenario, Do NOT include any borrowers without matching email addresses. (No co-borrowers without a match).
        2. When there are multiple Byte Borrower IDs identified in the previous step, there will be multiple tasks showing for that package, one for each Borrower ID.  The link for each task will be specific per borrower
      4. When package type = Pre Disclosure or Initial Disclosure, if there are multiple packages in Pending status, only the package with the most recent Created Date will display as task(s).  (All packages with Complete status will display)
    3. Dev Test Loans - Disclosures API Test MatriSx.xlsx
    4. Status determination
      1. If eSignDate or packageRetiredDate, or mailedHardCopyDate is populated, status = Complete
      2. If docLinkEpireDate < current date, status = Complete
      3. else status = Pending
    5. Data Points Tasks Matrix.xlsx
  4. Display value for Package Type:

  5. Task action button
    1. Clicking the Sign action button in the ToDo view, or the View action button in the Completed view, will transition the borrower to the eSign task action page
      1. Task Action page will be implemented under #79993
    2. When a task with status = Completed exists, and either of the following is true, the action button will be hidden.
      1. the docLinkExpireDate for that package is prior to current datetime
      2. the packageRetiredDate is populated
  6. If Esign task exists in Pending status, the tasks will be included in the total count of pending tasks which displays in the Loan Card of the Loan Dashboard. (Not applicable if Esign feature flag is disabled).

Acceptance Criteria

IDAcceptance Criteria
AC1 eSign Task Type displays only when Feature Flag #67129 is enabled.
AC2 eSign Task data retrieved from /api/v1/disclosures/packages/details/loanfile/{fileDataId}.
AC3 Only packages and data linked logged-in borrowers email matches (Byte Borrower ID) are displayed.  Multiple matches will result in multiple tasks, one for each matching borrower.  (Borrowers with email address that does NOT match will not have tasks shown.)
AC4 Status logic correctly assigns Completed vs Pending based on eSignDate, packageRetiredDate, or docLinkExpireDate.
AC5 Clicking Sign on a Pending task opens the eSign Action Page.
AC6 Clicking View on a Completed task opens the eSign Action Page.
AC7 No eSign tasks appear for borrowers when feature flag is disabled, or there are no eligible packages (delivery method not "eSign" or no packages exist.)
AC8 Only the most recent task for any PreDisclosure or Initial Disclosure package type is displayed.
AC9 Confirm pending task count in Loan Dashboard include Esign tasks (in addition to RON, DocUpload)
AC10 Confirm correct 'complete' date messaging displays for each package.

QA Notes

  • Feature Flag Validation:

    • Ensure eSign Task appears only when eSignTask feature flag active.

    • Disable flag confirm eSign Task hidden.

  • API Data Testing:

    • Verify /api/v1/disclosures/packages/details/loanfile/{fileDataId} response received for correct fildataid.

    • Confirm correct borrower-level filtering (Byte Borrower ID).

  • Status Logic Tests:

    • Verify transitions Pending Completed based on eSignDate / expireDate.

    • Validate expired packages show Completed state (Expired).

  • UI Navigation Tests:

    • Confirm Respond (Sign) button routes to eSign Action Page.

    • Confirm Completed View routes correctly.

  • Integration Tests:

    • Simulate vendor signing completion verify task status updated.

    • Confirm task status refresh in Task Page.

  • Regression:

    • Ensure other task types (Upload, RON) unaffected by new task logic.

  • Responsiveness:

    • Validate on desktop, tablet, mobile resolutions.

  • Task Display Logic
    • Multiple Initial Disclosures Packages have a task for only the most recent
    • Multiple borrowers on loan - only the task for the logged in borrower is displayed

title: CX | SmartApp | Update phone consent message for primary borrower
summary: Problem Statement: As a user, I want the consent message to be updated so that I have more information.
fullDescription:
Problem Statement:
As a user, I want the consent message to be updated so that I have more information.

Acceptance Criteria:
  1. The following text and links will be contained in a scroll box, replacing the existing consent text on secure.cmghomeloans.com/smart-application/contact-information/start:
    "By entering my mobile number and checking the box, I agree to receiving text and voice communications (including using autodialed or prerecorded messages) related to reminders, offers, and other information from CMG Mortgage, Inc. dba CMG Home Loans at the number provided. Consent is not a condition of purchase. Message frequency may vary. Message and data rates may apply. You can opt out at any time by replying STOP. View our terms and Privacy Policy."
    1. Clicking terms will open a modal with the following text:
      "Telephone and Communication Preferences Terms
      By providing my mobile number or other phone number and checking the box, I provide my prior express written consent to receive text messages, calls, and voice messages from CMG Mortgage, Inc. dba CMG Home Loans (and parties calling on their behalf) at the number I provided, even if a phone number is on a do-not-call list now or in the future. These messages may be informational and/or marketing in nature and may be sent using automated technology or may include pre-recorded, AI generative, or artificial voice messages. I acknowledge that my consent is not required to obtain any good or service. Message and data rates may apply.

      I also agree that this consent meets the requirements for electronic signatures under ESIGN, and by clicking "Save Changes", I confirm my understanding and acceptance of this agreement.

      You can opt out of calls or messages anytime by updating your communication preferences in your online account, replying STOP to any text message, contacting customer service, or by letting us know through other reasonable communication methods."
    2. Clicking Privacy Policy will open https://www.cmghomeloans.com/corporate/privacy-policy focused in a new tab.
  2. A checkbox will appear to the left of the scrollable consent message and will be required to be checked to continue in the application.

Current appearance:

 

Expected appearance:

title: Home Portal | Docutech - eSign Tasks Action Page
summary: ID Acceptance Criteria AC1 eSign Action Page accessible via Sign (To Do) and View (Completed) buttons from Task Framework.
fullDescription:
Problem Statement

Borrowers currently lack a way to electronically sign their disclosure document packages directly from the Home Portal. This requires external navigation, leading to inconsistent borrower experiences and lower completion rates.

Objective

Enable borrowers to access the Solex eSigning room to complete disclosure package signing directly through the Home Portals eSign Action Page.

This page will connect seamlessly with the eSign Task Type and use package data from EPS Disclosure data API response.

References

  • Design Figma: HP Task Card
    • Note that for any difference between the Figma and the mockups found in this requirement, the requirement version takes precedence.
  • Test Loans for Dev: Disclosures API Test Matrix.xlsx
  • Dashboard Access Ticket: #77063
  • Task Page Framework Ticket: #77067
  • eSign Task Item Ticket #69460
  • Feature Flag #67129

Scope

  • Implement the eSign Action Page to allow borrowers to view and sign their disclosure package via Solex.

  • Integrate with existing eSign Task Type (#69460) under the Task Framework.

  • Display and behavior will vary based on task status (Pending vs Completed).

  • Use data returned from the associated eSign Task package API.

  • Provide consistent navigation, header, and layout per the Home Portal framework.

  • Maintain compliance with Feature Flag #67129 for controlled rollout.

Dependencies

  • Feature Flag #67129 must be enabled for the Loan Officer assigned to the loan.

  • eSign Task Type (#69460) must be implemented and functional.

  • API Response: eSign package data provided via /api/v1/disclosures/packages/details/loanfile/{fileDataId} (EX team).

  • Solex integration must provide valid signing URLs within the docLink field.

Requirements
  1. This work item provides requirements for the eSign Action Page that allows the borrower to access the Solex signing room and esign a disclosure package.
  2. Source Data for Upload Tasks will be based on the package data associated with the eSign Task thru which the page was accessed
    1. Dev Test Loans - <pending>
    2. Task Matrix: 
      1. Reference full logic for eSign Task: Tasks Matrix.xlsx (eSign Logic tab)
      2. Reference Data Points for eSign Task: Tasks Matrix.xlsx (Docutech eSign tab)
  3. Access to the eSign task action page 
    1. Clicking the Sign action button for an Esign Task type in the ToDo view of the Task Framework UI, or the View action button for an Upload Task type in the Completed view, will transition the borrower to the upload action page.
  4. UI Layout
    1. Home Portal Header appears above the Upload Action page
      1. No changes to header options or layout
    2. Your Team panel appears at right
      1. No changes to Team panel
    3. Back to Tasks Link 
      1. Appears at the top left of the page
      2. When clicked, returns the borrower to the Tasks page
      3. The view (ToDo / Completed) displayed on transition is dependent upon the status of the task.
    4. Property and Loan Information
      1. Display the location icon, Property Location, and Loan # information at the top of the screen per the figma.  
      2. This should appear the same as in other Home Portal screens
    5. Task label: found at the top of the action page
      1. "E-Sign<package type>" - Uses same format as found in the task card
      2. Assigned to: Provides the name or names of the borrower(s) assigned to the item.
        1. For eSign task type, a task will only display when it is for the current logged-in borrower
      3. Description: "Please review and complete the following."
      4. Document Name: "<package type>"
    6. Status dependent UI components.  The following components are dependent upon the status of the task.
      1. Status = Pending (accessed from Tasks ToDo view)
        1. Back to Tasks link - transition user to Tasks Page with ToDo view
        2. Pending  

        3. Link Instructions: The instructions displayed will vary based upon the document package data.  However, for Pending Tasks, there is only one option, "Go Esign"
          1.  Reference Tasks Matrix.xlsx (Docutech eSign - Link Instructions) for full text to display.
          2. Reference Tasks Matrix.xlsx (eSign Logic tab) for full logic parameters to determine option displayed.
        4. Task Action Link button
          1. Displays in the bottom left of the screen
          2. Behavior - When user clicks the button
            1. Open new browser window
            2. Navigate to document URL specific to the document package
              1. URL is found in the docLink field under the Party object in the response payload
        5. Task Action button
          1. Label: Done
            1. Tasks Matrix.xlsx (eSign Logic tab) for full logic that determines label displayed.  For Pending tasks, "Done" will always display.
          2. When user clicks the button, User will transition back to the Tasks Page ToDo view 
            1. ALWAYS Refresh the eSign task data in the Task UI when transitioning back to the ToDo screen.  
            2. Note: There may be a delay in processing the package eSign status in Byte.  We are not doing any special handling for this scenario.
      2. Status = Complete (accessed from Tasks Completed view)
        1. Back to Tasks link - transitions user to Task Page with Completed view


        4. Status bar
          1. Green checkmark
          2. Message: Dependent upon document package data.  
            1. Reference Tasks Matrix.xlsx 'eSign Logic' tab - Status Bar Message column
        5. Document Name: <package type>
        6. Link Instructions: The instructions displayed will vary based upon the document package data.  For Completed Tasks, options are "View", "View or Esign", or "Link no longer valid."
            1.  Reference Tasks Matrix.xlsx (Docutech eSign - Link Instructions) for full text to display.
            2. Reference Tasks Matrix.xlsx (eSign Logic tab) for full logic parameters to determine which option to display.
        7. Task Action Button: 
          1. Reference full logic for eSign: Tasks Matrix.xlsx (eSign Logic tab)
          2. Show/Hide Logic: Action button will only display when both of the following are true.
            1. packageRetiredDate is not populated
            2. docLinkExpireDate is not prior to current date/time
          3. Label: Action button label 
            1. When shown, label the action button as follows in order of priority given
              1. "Go-Esign" when eSignDate is NOT populated and mailedHardCopyDate is NOT populated
                1. Task status will be "Pending"
              2. "View" when eSignDate is populated
                1. Task status will be "Complete"
              3. "View/Esign" when eSignDate is NOT populated and mailedHardCopyDate is populated
                1. Task status will be "Complete"
            2. Behavior: When user clicks the button
              1. Open new browser window
              2. Navigate to document URL specific to the document package
                1. URL is found in the docLink field under the Party object in the response payload

Acceptance Criteria

IDAcceptance Criteria
AC1 eSign Action Page accessible via Sign (To Do) and View (Completed) buttons from Task Framework.
AC2 Pending view displays correct package details, instructions, and active Sign button.
AC3 Clicking Go Esign link opens a new browser window and navigates to Solex signing URL from docLink.
AC4 Done button returns borrower to Task Page (To Do tab) and refreshes task data.
AC5 Completed view displays Task Completed bar, borrower name, and date.
AC6 View or View/eSign button in Completed view appears only when appropriate.
AC7 Clicking View opens Solex signing URL in new browser window.
AC8 Link Instructions display appropriate option based on disclosure package data.

QA Notes

  • API Testing:

    • Verify correct data rendering from eSign task API (packageType, docLink, expireDate).

    • Test with Retired packages and Expired Document Links (should open Completed view only).

  • Pending State Tests:

    • Confirm instructions text displays.

    • Validate Go Esign Link button opens correct Solex signing room.

    • Ensure Done button refreshes To Do tab upon return.

  • Completed State Tests:

    • Confirm Task Completed banner shows correct messaging. 

    • Validate Action button label logic based on retire and expire conditions.

    • Validate Link Instructions based on package data.

  • Navigation Tests:

    • Back to Tasks returns to correct tab view.

    • Validate new window handling and browser behavior.

  • Integration Tests:

    • Validate package data updates after eSign session completes.

    • Confirm no regression for Upload or RON task flows.

  • Responsive Layout:

    • Verify correct display on desktop, tablet, and mobile.

title: Home Portal | Allow user to navigate to dashboard from Verify Identity page after redirect for an app in servicing
summary: As a user, be able to return to my dashboard without verifying my identity so that I can complete other tasks.
fullDescription:
Problem Statement:
As a user, I want to be able to return to my dashboard without verifying my identity so that I can complete other tasks.

Problem found when testing: A loan application was created in UAT with FileDataID 5594536 which already exists in CX_SSO data. This caused the user to be stuck on the Verify Identity page even though the only loan app is not the same app that is in servicing.

Acceptance Criteria:
When a loan application is found in servicing data and the user is redirected to Verify Identity, the user will be allowed to navigate away to another page and return later to Verify Identity and update to a Mortgage Account.

Note: Loan Application will continue to show as post-funded until identity is verified

title: Home Portal | Enhance GET Document Upload Task workflow
summary: ID Acceptance Criteria AC1 System calls enhanced Clear Docs API and receives borrower names and application ID data.
fullDescription:
Problem Statement

The current Task Framework uses a multi-step, indirect workflow to determine which Document Upload Tasks should be shown to the borrower. Because the available Clear Docs API response does not always include borrower/co-borrower identification, the system relies on an additional call to loan summary data to determine:

  1. Which borrower(s) belong to the primary application

  2. The display order of borrowers

  3. Which applications Document Requests should be surfaced

This approach may prevent accurately populating Assigned To fields in the Document Upload Task display once we have more than the primary borrower in Smart App.

Objective

Implement a more accurate, and more flexible workflow for displaying Document Upload Tasks by leveraging enhancements to the Clear Docs API and EPS API.


The enhanced API will return borrower and co-borrower names directly within the Document Request payload, eliminating the need for display-order logic and improving borrower targeting.

This work will:

  • Use the enhanced Clear Docs API to determine Document Requests

  • Identify the borrower via email matching logic introduced in work item #69460

  • Display the correct Document Requests based on the borrowers associated Application ID(s)

  • Support multi-application and multi-match scenarios

  • Populate Assigned To using the borrower/co-borrower names in the enhanced Clear Docs response

References

  • Dependency: Borrower Identification Logic (Work Item #69460)

  • Clear Docs API Enhancement:
    GET https://devdocs.clear.online/api/v1/external/documentuploadrequests/filedataid
    (Now includes borrower & co-borrower name data)

  • Loan Summary API:
    api/v1/loanfiles/getloansummarybulk

Scope

  • Applies only to Document Upload Task Types within the Home Portal Task Framework.

  • Updates the logic for:

    • Determining which Document Requests belong to the logged-in borrower

    • Determining which Application ID(s) apply

    • Handling single-match vs. multiple-match borrower scenarios

    • Populating Assigned To in the Document Upload Task UI

  • Does not modify:

    • eSign Tasks (which follow a different multi-match rule)

    • RON Confirmation Tasks

    • Miscellaneous Upload Task

    • Task Page UI/UX

Success Metrics

  • Elimination of redundant display-order logic and secondary borrower calls

  • Correct Document Requests displayed across all borrower scenarios

  • Accurate Assigned To values, improving clarity for borrowers

  • Fewer support cases related to incorrect or missing Document Upload Tasks

Personas

PersonaDescription
Borrower Needs to see only the document requests associated with their own application(s).
Loan Officer / Processor Needs correct document visibility to avoid misdirected or incomplete uploads.

Use-Case Flow

  1. Borrower logs into Home Portal.

  2. System fetches Document Requests for the loan via the enhanced Clear Docs API.

  3. System fetches loan summary (borrower contact data) via getloansummarybulk.

  4. System performs borrower identification logic (#69460):

    • Match logged-in users email to borrower emails.

  5. System determines borrower email match scenario:

    • Single match show Document Requests for that Application ID

    • Multiple matches show Document Requests for all Application IDs tied to borrower matches

  6. System loads Document Upload Tasks into the Task Page UI.

  7. Assigned To field is populated using borrower name(s) from Clear Docs response.

Requirements

  1. #69460 Is expected to be completed prior to this work item.
    1. In code review as of 12/29/25
  2. Clear Docs api enhancement - GET https://devdocs.clear.online/api/v1/external/documentuploadrequests/filedataid
    1. Response payload will now include borrower / co-borrower names for application level document requests.
    2. Currently, we are making a 2nd call to get the borrowers associated to applications on the loan and the display order, We are then only showing the document requests associated with the application id of borrowers on the primary application based on the display order.
  3. New workflow for Document Upload Task display
    1. Call  GET https://devdocs.clear.online/api/v1/external/documentuploadrequests/filedataid
    2. Call API endpoint api/v1/loanfiles/getloansummarybulk for borrower contact information based on FileDataID
      1. New logic introduced under work item #69460
      2. Response will include an object for each application, with each borrower/coborrower associated
    3. Match the userid (email address) of the logged in user to the email address for each borrower in the response.
    4. When a match is found
      1. If a single match is found, display the Document Requests associated to the Application ID for the identified borrower.  
      2. If multiple matches are found, display the Document Requests associated to the Application IDs for all matching borrowers.
      3. Note that the multiple match behavior for document upload tasks differs from the behavior for esign tasks.
    5. Populate the Assigned To in the Task using the borrower / coborrower name(s) found in the Document Request response
  4. Note that we will need to ensure api updates do not affect current Secure Docs functionality.  

Acceptance Criteria

IDAcceptance Criteria
AC1 System calls enhanced Clear Docs API and receives borrower names and application ID data.
AC2 Borrower identification logic (#69460) correctly matches user email to borrower object(s).
AC3 Single match: Task list displays Document Requests for only the matched Application ID.
AC4 Multiple matches: Task list displays Document Requests for all matched Application IDs.
AC5 Multiple-match behavior differs from eSign tasks, where tasks are suppressed; verify correct divergence.
AC6 Assigned To field is populated using borrower/co-borrower names returned by Clear Docs.
AC7 System no longer uses display order or primary application only logic.
AC8 No Document Upload Tasks display when no borrower match is found.
AC9 No regression occurs to Upload Task Action Page (#22460), Task Framework (#77067), or eSign flows.

QA Notes

Test Scenarios

  1. Single Borrower Match

    • One borrower with matching email

    • Confirm only their applications Document Requests appear

  2. Multiple Borrower Match

    • Logged-in user email appears under 2+ borrower entries

    • Confirm all associated Application IDs are included

    • Confirm eSign tasks behave differently

  3. No Match

    • Logged-in user email does not match any borrower

    • Confirm no Document Upload Tasks display

  4. Assigned To Validation

    • Confirm names shown match exactly what Clear Docs returns

  5. Regression

    • Ensure Upload Action Page displays correctly

    • Ensure filtering, sorting, counts are unchanged

    • Confirm eSign behavior remains unaffected

title: Home Portal | Remove Feature Flag Miscellaneous Upload Document Task
summary: Scope Remove feature flag: MiscDocTask ..
fullDescription:
Scope

  • Remove feature flag: MiscDocTask.

title: Tech Debt | Smart App | Remove Route History for ApplicationJSONStateString
summary: Currently, we really only seed the sectionURL and routeURL to update the application state for a user.
fullDescription:
Currently, we really only seed the sectionURL and routeURL to update the application state for a user. The routeHistory has been largely replaced with the progress indicator logic in the UI, but we are still setting it throughout the application even though it's not actually being used anywhere. 
We should remove routeHistory from the ApplicationJSONStateString and remove any references to it in the UI.

title: Home Portal | Upload Document - Add Doc Type(s) to Completed Task
summary: As a borrower, I want the ability to see the doctype(s) of the document(s) I uploaded to my completed tasks. Objective Provide borrower visibility to the doctype of documents used to complete a document upload task. Personas Persona Description Borrower Needs to upload miscellaneous documents securely in support of their loan application. Loan Officer (LO) Receives documents from borrower Requirements Current behavior:, a document is uploaded via tasks, the completed task then displays in the Completed tasks view with the task label used to upload.
fullDescription:
Problem Statement

As a borrower, I want the ability to see the doctype(s) of the document(s) I uploaded to my completed tasks.

Objective

Provide borrower visibility to the doctype of documents used to complete a document upload task.

Personas

PersonaDescription
Borrower Needs to upload miscellaneous documents securely in support of their loan application.
Loan Officer (LO) Receives documents from borrower

Requirements
  1. Current behavior: when a document is uploaded via tasks, the completed task then displays in the Completed tasks view with the task label used to upload.  No further information is provided.

  2. Desired behavior:
    1. When a document is uploaded via tasks, the doctype for any document which is associated to the document request will display within the task action page for the completed task. 
      1. Currently, when a doctype is updated, only the document is updated, the document request remains unchanged.
      2. Clear Docs is updating the response payload for Doc Requests to include the DocType for each document associated.  


  3. Requirements
    1. Remove the "Added <date>" from the Completed View
    2. Below the Task Completed banner, add 
      1. Title: File(s) Received
      2. Body: Document Type List - based on doc type for the documents associated to a document request.

title: Servicing | Update message shown when there are no documents available
summary: As a user, be given more information about when to expect my documents so that I know when to check again.
fullDescription:
Problem Statement: 
As a user, I want to be given more information about when to expect my documents so that I know when to check again.

Acceptance Criteria:
  1. The message which appears on the Documents page for a loan which is returning no documents will be changed to "We're working on getting your loan documents loaded here. They should be available to view and download within approximately 10 business days from the date your loan closed."
  2. If there is an error with retrieving the documents, the red alert error message "Not all data was able to be retrieved. Try refreshing your browser. If the issue persists, come back later." will appear at the top of the card.

Current appearance:

title: CX | SmartApp | Add Phone Type and consent disclaimer to co-borrower information page
summary: Lisa WolfeProblem Statement: As a user, I want the consent message to be updated so that I have more information.
fullDescription:
Lisa WolfeProblem Statement:
As a user, I want the consent message to be updated so that I have more information.

Acceptance Criteria:
The following changes will be made to the Coborrower Information page (secure.cmghomeloans.com/smart-application/coborrower-information/coborrower-info):
  1. Phone Type field will be added below Phone field and user will be able to select Mobile, Home, or Work.
    1. Number entered into the Phone field will be populated to the corresponding Byte field for that Phone Type (currently the Phone number maps to Mobile every time for coborrower).
  2. The following text and links will be contained in a scroll box below the Phone Type field:
    "By entering my mobile number or other phone number and checking the box, I agree to receiving text and voice communications (including using autodialed or prerecorded messages) related to reminders, offers, and other information from CMG Mortgage, Inc. dba CMG Home Loans at the number provided. Consent is not a condition of purchase. Message frequency may vary. Message and data rates may apply. You can opt out at any time by replying STOP. View our terms and Privacy Policy.�
    1. Clicking terms will open a modal with the following text:
      "Telephone and Communication Preferences Terms
      By providing my mobile number or other phone number and checking the box, I provide my prior express written consent to receive text messages, calls, and voice messages from CMG Mortgage, Inc. dba CMG Home Loans (and parties calling on their behalf) at the number I provided, even if a phone number is on a do-not-call list now or in the future. These messages may be informational and/or marketing in nature and may be sent using automated technology or may include pre-recorded, AI generative, or artificial voice messages. I acknowledge that my consent is not required to obtain any good or service. Message and data rates may apply.

      I also agree that this consent meets the requirements for electronic signatures under ESIGN, and by clicking "Save Changes", I confirm my understanding and acceptance of this agreement.

      You can opt out of calls or messages anytime by updating your communication preferences in your online account, replying STOP to any text message, contacting customer service, or by letting us know through other reasonable communication methods."
    2. Clicking Privacy Policy will open https://www.cmghomeloans.com/corporate/privacy-policy focused in a new tab.
  3. A checkbox will appear to the left of the scrollable consent message and will be required to be checked to continue in the application.

 

 

Current appearance:

 

Expected appearance:

title: Tech Debt | Remove unused Aspose.PDF.Drawing-related document generation code and clean up Docker components from TP API
summary: As a Home Portal Developer, remove unused document-generation code that depends on Aspose.
fullDescription:
As a Home Portal Developer
I want to remove unused document-generation code that depends on Aspose.PDF.Drawing and to remove any Docker-layer components/settings installed solely to support Aspose from Third Party API
So that, we reduce technical debt, simplify builds and containers, minimize attack surface, and lower maintenance/compute costs.
Note:
The document generation code was previously used in the AccountChek flow, which has since been deprecated and removed. 

A.C: 
References to aspose.pdf should be removed. 
Solution should build locally and in pipeline. 
Regression tests should pass.

title: CX Partner Co-Branding | Real Estate Agent card Headshot and Company Logo visibility in all Your Home Team locations
summary: As a customer, have visibility of my Real Estate Agent's headshot and company logo in all Your Home Team locations, so that I can easily identify and connect with my Real Estate Agent throughout my loan journey.
fullDescription:
**Problem Statement:**  

  

As a customer, I want to have visibility of my Real Estate Agent's headshot and company logo in all Your Home Team locations, so that I can easily identify and connect with my Real Estate Agent throughout my loan journey.  

  

**Acceptance Criteria:**  

  

### 1. API Integration  

  

Real Estate Agent headshot and company logo will be retrieved from Partner Portal API endpoint:  

- **API Endpoint**: GET /api/v1/partners/{guid}  

- **Headshot Field**: `headshotURL`  

- **Company Logo Field**: `companyLogoURL`  

- **API Documentation**: https://cmgpartnerportalapiappdev01.azurewebsites.net/swagger/index.html#/Partner/Partner_GetPartnerByGUID_GET  

  

### 2. Image Transformations  

  

Both headshot and company logo will be transformed via Cloudinary URL parameters using the same transformations as Loan Officer headshot and company logo:  

- Headshot: Faces transformation for circular display  

- Company Logo: Fit transformation for rectangular display  

  

### 3. SmartApp Display  

  

Real Estate Agent card in SmartApp will display headshot and company logo in both collapsed and expanded states as depicted in the mockups when:  

- Co-branded URL is used, OR  

- Co-Branded Real Estate Agent is added via Applications Pipeline in Clear  

  

**SmartApp - Real Estate Agent Card (Collapsed State):**  

  

![image.png](https://cmgfidev.visualstudio.com/84000f10-6c77-4628-a772-531c4c796272/_apis/wit/attachments/ad8d7566-e012-4e9d-a50e-c326d500ac21?fileName=image.png) 
  

**SmartApp - Real Estate Agent Card (Expanded State):**  

  

![image.png](https://cmgfidev.visualstudio.com/84000f10-6c77-4628-a772-531c4c796272/_apis/wit/attachments/ed573ea0-0ad8-4e59-82d2-f85f39ae7194?fileName=image.png) 

  

### 4. Home Portal Dashboard Display  

  

Real Estate Agent card in Home Portal dashboards will display headshot and company logo in both collapsed and expanded states as depicted in the mockups when file has Co-Branded Real Estate Agent associated with it:  

- Co-Branded Real Estate Agent is populated at application level prior to it becoming a Byte file, OR  

- `[ExtendedFields.CoBrandedREA]` is populated when file has a Byte loan  

  

**Home Portal Dashboard Locations:**  

1. Application Submitted but Loan Not Yet Created  

2. Loan in Progress  

3. Funded  

4. Servicing  

  

**Home Portal - Real Estate Agent Card (Collapsed State):**  

  

![image.png](https://cmgfidev.visualstudio.com/84000f10-6c77-4628-a772-531c4c796272/_apis/wit/attachments/511fa5b8-1a2a-4613-b324-6fa12e574a55?fileName=image.png) 

  

**Home Portal - Real Estate Agent Card (Expanded State):**  

  
![image.png](https://cmgfidev.visualstudio.com/84000f10-6c77-4628-a772-531c4c796272/_apis/wit/attachments/b157c119-0e4b-4208-90f1-c7256f72ca5f?fileName=image.png) 
  

### 5. Tasks Page Display  

  

Real Estate Agent card on Tasks page will display headshot and company logo when file has Co-Branded Real Estate Agent associated with it  

  

### 6. Secure Doc Upload Display  

  

Real Estate Agent card on Secure Doc Upload page will display headshot and company logo when file has Co-Branded Real Estate Agent associated with it  

  

### 7. Missing Headshot and Company Logo Handling  

  

When partner headshot and/or company logo are missing, Real Estate Agent cards will be displayed as they appear today:  

- When `headshotURL` is blank or null, partner's initials will be displayed in place of the headshot image  

- When `companyLogoURL` is blank or null, the logo will not be displayed in the Real Estate Agent card  

  

**SmartApp - Real Estate Agent Card (No Headshot/Logo - Collapsed State):**  

  

![image.png](https://cmgfidev.visualstudio.com/84000f10-6c77-4628-a772-531c4c796272/_apis/wit/attachments/6bc28896-ba46-416a-8f16-47645efd2dee?fileName=image.png) 

  

**SmartApp - Real Estate Agent Card (No Headshot/Logo - Expanded State):**  

  

![image.png](https://cmgfidev.visualstudio.com/84000f10-6c77-4628-a772-531c4c796272/_apis/wit/attachments/118d1c32-d56d-4887-bcb9-104b03f271ba?fileName=image.png) 
  

**Home Portal - Real Estate Agent Card (No Headshot/Logo - Collapsed State):**  

  

![image.png](https://cmgfidev.visualstudio.com/84000f10-6c77-4628-a772-531c4c796272/_apis/wit/attachments/b1ec5d92-31eb-432c-81d0-d0b38cde86b7?fileName=image.png) 

  

**Home Portal - Real Estate Agent Card (No Headshot/Logo - Expanded State):**  

  

![image.png](https://cmgfidev.visualstudio.com/84000f10-6c77-4628-a772-531c4c796272/_apis/wit/attachments/2b270848-3cd1-46fa-9331-6622a5d39496?fileName=image.png) 

**Testing Notes**
- Enable `partnerCoBranding` feature flag.

title: Servicing | Upgrade Aspen Grove widgets to 1.50.0
summary: This version includes a few minor but significant changes: AP 1.50: The business-day control logic has been adjusted (3 business days, or 4 if past the cutoff time) when accessing the Edit / Delete AutoPay view.
fullDescription:
This version includes a few minor but significant changes:

  • AP 1.50: The business-day control logic has been adjusted (3 business days, or 4 if past the cutoff time) when accessing the Edit / Delete AutoPay view. This change is now consistent with the logic already implemented before for the available date selection when a user is setting up a new AutoPay.
  • Bank account form: "Account holder" is now a mandatory field according to requirement's from Sagent.
  • �Payments cannot be in the past� issue:
    This error, identified through active log inspection, occurred in specific scenarios. For example, when a user on the Pacific Coast (PT timezone) attempted to make a payment at 10:00 PM local time, the system allowed selecting the current date, but the backend returned an error because, in ET, the date had already rolled over to the next day.
    This has been fixed by ensuring that the available date range is calculated based on the current day in ET, regardless of the user�s actual location or timezone.

If you want to test this specific scenario, you can wait until after 12:00 AM ET, then change your laptop�s timezone (it�s also possible to simulate a different timezone via the browser, though it�s more complex). Set it to a timezone that is still on the previous day, such as PT, and try selecting the previous date - the widget should not allow it.

 

In the screenshot attached as an example, after 12:00 AM ET, I changed my timezone to PT. 

Even though it was still the 1st in PT, the system no longer allowed me to select that date, since it was already the 2nd in ET:

title: Home Portal | Update Mortgage Calculator Computational Logic with Code Fix for 1/8 Point Interest Values
summary: As a Home Portal user, I want the Mortgage Calculator to correctly calculate payments for interest rates ending in 1/8th increments (.125, .375, .625, .875), so that mortgage payment calculations are accurate and consistent with expected financial standards The existing Mortgage Calculator rounds up incorrectly, calculating payments for interest rates ending in 1/8th point increments (.
fullDescription:
Problem Statement:  

As a Home Portal user, I want the Mortgage Calculator to correctly calculate payments for interest rates ending in 1/8th increments (.125, .375, .625, .875), so that mortgage payment calculations are accurate and consistent with expected financial standards

The existing Mortgage Calculator rounds up incorrectly when calculating payments for interest rates ending in 1/8th point increments (.125, .375, .625, .875).

Proposed Solution: The POC team has implemented a fix and is submitting a PR to push the code. Our team will need to review the PR and upgrade to the new calculator package in the CONX app with the code fix.

Acceptance Criteria

  1. Package Upgrade
    • The CONX application is updated to use the new Mortgage Calculator code fix provided by the POC team.
    • The upgrade is completed via an approved pull request and published by the CX development team.
  2. Correct Interest Rate Calculations
    • Mortgage calculations using interest rates ending in:
      • .125
      • .375
      • .625
      • .875
        produce accurate results and do not round up incorrectly.
    • Calculations align with the expected financial formula and business requirements.
    • For ease of use, I have included some test scenarios below.  The BankRate calculator is an industry standard, and our calculated values should match those in the BankRate column.

      Mortgage Calculator 1/8 Pt. Rounding Test Scenarios
      # Loan Amount Term Interest Rate Bankrate Mo. Pymt. Calc Result 
      1 500000 30yr 6.125 3038
      2 650000 30yr 6.375 4055
      3 825000 30yr 6.625 5283
      4 925000 30yr 6.875 6077
      5 1100000 30yr 7.125 7411
      6 500000 15 yr 6.125 4253
      7 650000 15 yr 6.375 5618
      8 825000 15 yr 6.625 7243
      9 925000 15 yr 6.875 8250
      10 1100000 15 yr 7.125 9964
  3. Regression Validation
    • Existing Mortgage Calculator functionality continues to work as expected for non�1/8th increment interest rates.
    • No regressions are introduced as a result of the code fix.

title: Servicing | Extend SSN search to include coborrowers for displaying servicing dashboard
summary: As a user, be able to view my mortgage account dashboard so that I can manage my loan.

and the user successfully completed identity verification,

Note:
This user is unable to view their mortgage account/servicing dashboard. They originated the SmartApp, but Byte shows Deborah as secondary borrower. The dashboard shows as post-funded.

title: Tech Debt | Send Loan-Conversion Service Bus Messages to Additional Topic
summary: CMG is working to standardize/unify the Service Bus setup across the organization.
fullDescription:
CMG is working to standardize/unify the Service Bus setup across the organization.  This requires creating new topics to adhere to new naming/organization standards.

In order to manage the migration to new topics, we need to send all messages that currently go to the `originationloanapplicationconversion` topic to the `origination-cx-loanapplicationconversion` topic as well.  A future story will remove sending to the `originationloanapplicationconversion` at such time that it is retired.

title: Tech Debt | Performance Improvements to usp_GetPipelineLoanApplicationList
summary: When Clear calls the `/api/v1/external/loanapplications/pipeline` endpoint, this eventually gets to the `usp_GetPipelineLoanApplicationList` stored procedure.
fullDescription:
When Clear calls the `/api/v1/external/loanapplications/pipeline` endpoint, this eventually gets to the `usp_GetPipelineLoanApplicationList` stored procedure.  This stored procedure does not perform well for certain loads, primarily related to processing of the loan-officer list and a missing indexes.

Change the stored procedure to better handle a list of loan officers and add the appropriate indexes to improve overall performance of the stored procedure.

title: Tech Debt | Database Query Improvements for ExternalController.GetLoanApplicationsByGUIDsAsync
summary: When the `/api/v1/external/loanapplications` is called with a list of Loan Application GUID's, each GUID is retrieved separately, and each GUID process results in four separate database queries.
fullDescription:
When the `/api/v1/external/loanapplications` is called with a list of Loan Application GUID's, each GUID is retrieved separately, and each GUID process results in four separate database queries.  Under high loads this can cause timeout errors that create a cascade of retries and swamp the database I/O.

In addition to cancellation-token support in #92558, refactor the database interaction to retrieve all data in a single database call.

summary: Banner is present for all servicing clients as expected Email from stakeholders attached .
fullDescription:
ADD a Blue announcement banner to mortgage accounts in servicing.  Location at top of screen.

  • Banner is present for all servicing clients as expected

  1. Submitted Loan Application
    1. Logo top of screen
    2. CMG Home Loans in first sentence
    3. If button isn't displaying, copy and paste the following url into browser window:  bankcmg url
    4. If you have questions: BankCMG LO
    5. Footer disclaimer
  2. Finished Loan Application to Borrower
    1. Logo top of screen
    2. If button isn't displaying, copy and paste the following url into browser window:  bankcmg url
    3. If you have questions: BankCMG LO
    4. Footer disclaimer
  • All Loan Officer emails branded to CMG Home Loans still

title: Home Portal | Turn off Your Homes Dashboard for BankCMG via feature flag temporarily
summary: Purpose Currently the BankCMG branded HouseCanary site has been created, and the SAML integration has been setup and is working between our the BankCMG Home Portal and the BankCMG HouseCanary site.
fullDescription:
Purpose

Currently the BankCMG branded HouseCanary site has been created, and the SAML integration has been setup and is working between our the BankCMG Home Portal and the BankCMG HouseCanary site.

However, any API call we make from the CONX API is using the ClientID/Secret for the CMG branded site, and not the BankCMG branded site.  This means some functionality such as claiming properties, saving searches, or saving homes on the BankCMG HC site will not reflect in the BankCMG home portal.   

There is a ticket being created to solve this on the API side, but until that work can be done we want to turn off the "Your Homes" dashboard on the BankCMG branded site, since this is the only area that currently has issues due to the problems stated above.

Expectation

The BankCMG branded Home Portal will NOT show the Your Homes link in the header, or allow you to navigate directly to the your homes dashboard.

The CMG branded site will continue to allow this.

This work should be done behind a feature flag, so that we can turn this dashboard back on once we complete the HC related API work to use the new BankCMG ClientId/Secret.
